title: Folders in Bookmarks Menu not displayed in dropdown menu
content:
I recently switched to Firefox and imported all of my chrome bookmarks. When I open the Bookmarks viewer (Ctrl-B) in the sidebar or the Library ("Manage Bookmarks"/Ctrl-Shift-O), the "Bookmarks Menu" folder contains all of my properly organized bookmarks in a tree of subfolders, just like I expect.

But when I open the "hamburger" menu on the upper-right corner and select Bookmarks, It only shows a list of "Recent Bookmarks" (along with some options to manage bookmarks). I tried using the "Customize Toolbar" feature to add the Bookmarks Menu to the toolbar, but when I open it, it just shows the same thing as if I had gone through the hamburger menu.

I tried looking through Settings, but I couldn't find an option to access my "Bookmarks Menu" from a dropdown menu instead of having to open the sidebar or the Library every time. Is there something I'm missing?

title: Internet connectivity issues
content:
Long story here:

A few weeks ago, I lost internet connectivity on my desktop PC at work running Windows 11. I checked Firefox, Edge & Chrome but couldn't access any site. It took a few hours and a lot of updating Windows, rebooting each time the internet kicked out, but I got it to work again.

Fast forward to this past Monday the 29th when the issue happened again. Within roughly a minute, the internet just died on my desktop again. I grabbed my work laptop, also running Windows 11: same issue happened within 60 seconds. I checked Firefox on a desktop running Windows 10 - had no issues at all.

Today, I installed Firefox on another laptop (the same model at the other one) running Windows 11. As soon as it synced my account, the internet stopped working. I though it may be the Sync option, so I reinstalled Firefox on my laptop but did not log in to Sync - the same issue: dead internet within 30 seconds now.

I have:

  • Run anti-virus
  • Run network diagnostics and reset
  • Rebooted a multitude of times
  • Uninstalled, reinstalled at least twice
  • Run troubleshooting in Firefox (which I cannot attach the logs due to it being uninstalled right now)
  • Checked to make sure my modem/routers are working right (no one else in the building has this issue and we all use Firefox, but none are synced to my account)
  • I even asked my company's tech team (who are mostly software developers) and they said No, sorry, we don't help with that (wonderful right?)

I've attached a screenshot of the OG machine's information. Not sure if it will help at all, but it's worth a shot.
creator: thewildeorchids

title: "Getting Help Made Easy: Explore Mozilla Support"
content: The Mozilla Support platform provides users with helpful resources to troubleshoot issues, learn about Firefox, and explore other Mozilla products. It features a wide range of articles, step-by-step guides, and frequently asked questions, covering topics from browser customization to privacy settings. Users can search for solutions or ask questions in the community forum, where experienced volunteers and staff offer assistance. Mozilla Support is available in multiple languages, making it accessible worldwide. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced user, the platform ensures quick, reliable help to enhance your browsing experience and stay informed about the latest Firefox features and updates. https://www.business.reddit.com/ for further details.

title: Can no longer connect to my Netgear NAS
content:
I used to be able to connect with Firefox (with a warning message from you) to my local Netgear NAS, but now it just says:

Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to 192.168.1.100. Peer using unsupported version of security protocol. Error code: SSL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. Please contact the web site owners to inform them of this problem. This web site might not support the TLS 1.2 protocol, which is the minimum version supported by Firefox.

How can I still override this with Firefox. It's really important I can connect to my NAS.

With thanks,

Nick Curley

The abve pages work fine in Safari. I have used FF for ever since the first release, but am considering ditching it now. I can't find anything about this problem googling.

Please help!!!

title: Firefox high memory usage after latest update on Windows 11
content:
Hi everyone,

After updating to the latest version of Firefox on Windows 11, I’ve noticed unusually high memory usage. Even with only a few tabs open, Task Manager shows Firefox consuming a lot more RAM than before.

For instance, earlier today I had a couple of news sites and the Dunkin Donuts Menu page open, and memory usage spiked to nearly 2 GB, causing the browser to slow down. Closing tabs doesn’t always free up the memory, and sometimes I have to fully restart Firefox.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

Disabled all extensions and themes.

Cleared cache and browsing history.

Refreshed Firefox.

Unfortunately, none of these steps have helped so far.

Has anyone else experienced this memory issue after the recent update? Are there any specific settings or tweaks that can help manage Firefox’s resource usage better?

Thanks in advance for any suggestions.
creator: tanveerceo73

title: Default to open links in a new Tab Does Not Work
content:
Hello- When I am on a website and click link I would expect and want a new Tab to open-- I want it to open it in a new Tab and leave the page I'm on alone so I can go back to the original page.

Instead, Firefox overwrites that page and the tab with the a new one, and I have to hit the back button to get back to that original page. And most often the back arrow button is grayed out and I can't get back at all.

In settings, I've tried checking the box for: 'Open links in tabs instead of new windows' but that doesn't do it. I've also tried checking the box, 'When you open a link in a new tab, switch to it immediately,' and that doesn't do it either.

I know that a work-around is to hold down the Ctrl key while clicking a link, but I'd like to set it as a default so I don't have to do that. That's a pain and not a natural function when browsing. To be sure, I want to click on links and that creates a new Tab without Ctrl Keys.

Thanks!
creator: StevenLAX16

title: Tabs and cookies lost. Browsing history remains.
content:
When I turned on my computer this morning, and opened Firefox, it froze, and had to be process-ended by Windows.

Subsequently, it also caused Windows Explorer crash.

I was forced to hard-reboot my computer, and restarted it to find all my tabs gone and unrecoverable, and all cookies deleted.

However, my browsing history remains.

Furthermore, my attempt at recovery of this data via the automated backup taken Monday 29 September 2025 - three days before this post - accomplished nothing.

I have looked in several places here, and found no help at all in recovering lost tabs. All threads remain unresolved.

Please provide troubleshooting assistance ASAP.

(And please be aware that the software had to be opened in order to post this question.)
creator: arratradrakenguard

title: Downgrade firefox without losing older profile
content:
The article explaining why one should not downgrade ignores a critical reason why one needs to downgrade and that is when it turns out that the new version breaks an existing website!

I got bitten by this when Firefox "upgraded" me to V143 after which point the ticket system I use to support my customers stopped working. That same ticket system continues to work fine in Safari, Edge, Chrome and Brave, etc.

Worse, when one does try to downgrade, the old profile gets removed which means you lose EVERYTHING you had (tabs, bookmarks and presumably all the settings and saved passwords, etc). You need to be keeping the old profiles around so that they can be accessed again should someone NEED to downgrade. Fortunately I was able to use Time Machine to recover the old profile --- but somebody just didn't think this through.

Much as I have loved Firefox over the years, I'm starting to feel that it's time to give up on it and move to something else.

Turning off automatic updates is not a solution because eventually one will choose to upgrade manually and most people won't remember to make a copy of their existing profile. Should one then encounter a problem, you're back to square one

Very disappointing .

title: Không biết bao giờ browser hỗ trợ dịch từ ngôn ngữ khác sang tiếng Việt nhỉ?
content: Tôi muốn hỏi rằng Mozilla có kế hoạch nào để tích hợp sẵn tính năng dịch trang web từ các ngôn ngữ khác sang tiếng Việt trong trình duyệt Firefox hay không? Đây là một tính năng rất cần thiết, đặc biệt là đối với tôi khi thường xuyên đọc tài liệu nước ngoài. Việc gặp phải những từ khó khiến quá trình đọc hiểu trở nên chậm hơn, vì vậy nếu có sẵn tính năng dịch từ ngôn ngữ khác sang tiếng Việt thì sẽ vô cùng tiện lợi và hữu ích. Tôi nhận thấy hiện nay trình duyệt đã hỗ trợ dịch từ tiếng Việt sang tiếng Anh, nhưng chiều ngược lại thì chưa có. Rất mong cộng đồng hoặc đội ngũ phát triển có thể chia sẻ thêm thông tin về việc liệu tính năng này có nằm trong kế hoạch phát triển tương lai hay không, và nếu có thì dự kiến khi nào sẽ ra mắt. Xin chân thành cảm ơn!
creator: thuantran.123

title: Gmail treating emails as spam
content: Hi I am the postmaster for my Probus club. https://www.probusneutralbay.org/ Gmail is treating my generic club emails as spam: Probusnb Post Master<probusnbpostmaster@gmail.com> The suggested fixes - SPF / DKIM / DMARC seem to be overkill and a bit beyond my tech skills. Is there a simpler way to stop Gmail treating my emails as spam? I can send bulk emails using my personal Gmail address. This may have nothing to do with Mozilla but I thought I would ask. Many thanks Paul Shea +61 434 518 498

title: FF OneTab on Widnows 10 Pro
content:
When using "about:support" on Firefox I'm not seeing my "profile path". Are there instructions on this method to make sure I don't loose all of my OneTab-tabs, or should I use another method? A FF comment: If you have a backup of this profile folder than you can restore your data...where do I find this folder?

You also suggest using a backup program--not sure what this means. How do I run backup software on my computer to restore my Firefox profile folder (a file path) ? I do have an external hard drive continuously backing up my files, however I don't know if this will back up browser settings/data whether it does or not- do I need to search for doing this from the manufacturer or from you.

Another suggestion from your help articles: If you don't use our "backup/sync feature, then the only way to recover the deleted data is if (a repeat of the above suggestion )you run backup software on your computer that can restore your Firefox profile folder.

I'm confused on what the backup/sync feature is referring to, unless you're talking (install FF on my Chromebook" so that it puts all my settings and data onto that device? ...sorry.

My problem is Microsoft is giving ppl until Oct 13th (2 weeks away) to upgrade to windows 11. I'm afraid I'll lose all of the FF windows and tabs that I moved into OneTab. This was hundreds of hours of work not to mention the amount of money I've paid to access these websites for research.

Any response would be greatly appreciated...I saw a comment that FF is working on a solution for this but I may not get it until it's to late.

~~Sharp63 (LOL I'm now 78)

OMG..I just saw and update available for FF. Based on what I just read, it's possible I'll lose all of the data in OneTab, What should I do...thinking! First thing is I'll look to see what the update is about, then decide.
creator: sharp63
